problem_text_en:
A cuboid-shaped container that is not filled completely contains $150 \mathrm{~m}^{3}$ of water. The depth of the water is either $2.5 \mathrm{~m}$ or $3.5 \mathrm{~m}$ or $6 \mathrm{~m}$, depending on which side the container is actually standing on (drawings not to scale). How big is the volume of the container?
<image1> A. $280 \mathrm{~m}^{3}$
 B. $300 \mathrm{~m}^{3}$
 C. $320 \mathrm{~m}^{3}$
 D. $340 \mathrm{~m}^{3}$
 E. $360 \mathrm{~m}^{3}$
